1: Water boils at 100 degrees Celsius at sea level.
2: The Earth revolves around the Sun.
3: Humans have 206 bones in their adult bodies.
4: The chemical symbol for gold is Au.

7: There are eight planets in the Solar System.
8: The speed of light in a vacuum is approximately 299,792 kilometers per second.
9: Oxygen makes up about 21% of Earth's atmosphere.
10: The atomic number of carbon is 6.
11: Mount Everest is the highest mountain on Earth.

13: Africa is the second largest continent by area.
14: Tokyo is the capital of Japan.
15: Canada has the longest coastline of any country.
16: The Sahara is the largest hot desert in the world.
17: Russia is the largest country by land area.
18: Australia is both a country and a continent.
20: Antarctica is the coldest continent on Earth.
21: The Declaration of Independence was signed in 1776.
23: Julius Caesar was assassinated in 44 BCE.
25: The Wright brothers flew the first powered airplane in 1903.
26: Abraham Lincoln was the 16th president of the United States.
27: The Roman Empire officially fell in 476 AD.
30: The Great Fire of London occurred in 1666.
31: William Shakespeare wrote Romeo and Juliet.
33: The Iliad and the Odyssey are attributed to Homer.
36: Moby-Dick was written by Herman Melville.
37: The Latin alphabet is used in most Western languages.
38: The Harry Potter series was written by J.K. Rowling.
39: The Nobel Prize in Literature was first awarded in 1901.
44: The Pythagorean theorem applies to right-angled triangles.
46: Prime numbers are only divisible by 1 and themselves.
50: The Fibonacci sequence begins with 0 and 1.
51: The first iPhone was released in 2007.
53: The internet was originally developed by the U.S. Department of Defense.
54: HTML stands for HyperText Markup Language.
55: A byte is made up of 8 bits.
56: Linux is an open-source operating system.
57: The World Wide Web was invented by Tim Berners-Lee.
58: Python is not mainly used for designing website layouts and styling pages.
60: A GPU is used for graphics processing.
61: The Beatles were a British rock band.
62: The Marvel Cinematic Universe began with Iron Man in 2008.
63: The Godfather was directed by Francis Ford Coppola.
64: Michael Jackson is known as the “King of Pop.”
65: The Simpsons is the longest-running American animated TV show.
66: Beyoncé was a member of Destiny’s Child.
67: Netflix was founded as a DVD rental service.
68: The Oscars are formally known as the Academy Awards.
73: A group of lions is called a pride.
74: The blue whale is the largest animal on Earth.
76: A honeybee can sting only once.
77: Elephants have the largest brains of any land animal.
79: Coral reefs are made from living organisms.
